summary: Inquisitive and committed project engineering professional with 15 years of progressive experience across a range of engineering functions in the (medical) manufacturing segment. Proven ability to drive and lead complex operations and projects in a multinational setting (including Asia Pacific). Providing change/program management expertise covering most operational departments. Lean, quality driven, chasing excellent knowledge of people, products, processes and politics within the scope. Performance and people manager with strong multilevel and multinational negotiation skills pursuing a healthy and prosperous business environment for all.

profile_positions.description:
Recruited for the industrialization of ultrasound medical diagnostic devices and its accessories. 
Set up and maintained Device Master Records (BOM, routing, SOP’s), defined the Shop Floor Control plan (layout, flow, equipment, traceability), facilitated production starts and executed production transfers from Europe to China.
Appointed as (program) management interface within SEMT in Shenzhen (expatriate in China). Reporting directly to GM, planned and led high level projects (NPI’s, transfers, lean, local sales), initiated continues quality improvement programs and managed key customer & contract manufacturer accounts.

 Managed Esaote daily business activities within Sanmina EMS (annually >$10M). Consulted with their Customer Focus Team to reach targets (KPI’s), solve issues and harmonize all mutual operations (delivery, quality, costing, engineering, business reviews, audits and relationship).
 Coordinated the complete production transfer to a different facility (1700 m2), from sourcing potential partners to validation of all processes and products at the new site.
 Launched over 10 ultrasound system configurations for the Chinese market. Configured to local market requirements according Chinese regulations (SFDA), with Mandarin user interface.
 Created part/product inspection criteria for the whole Esaote Group.
 Ran in parallel 2 international production transfers and 2 new product introductions. Including supply chain localization, part/supplier validation, training, auditing, trail runs and ramp up.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Hired to set up product specifications of a cardio-logic blood pressure meter. Made dedicated documentation packages for all commodities according industry regulations (ISO13485/FDA).
Promoted to coordinate engineering changes. Responsible for management of all product related specifications. Made sure that ERP, SFC and DC systems were filled with accurate information. Logged all system changes and arranged regular EC meetings internally as well with customers and suppliers.

 Introduced product quality guidance’s to strengthen the quality control plans. These inspection instructions along the manufacturing process assured acceptable quality and reduced rework activities significantly.
 Developed a detection instrument for Enraf Marine Systems, used to identify hydrocarbon gas within ballast tanks of vessels. Prepared concepts, designed initial model, built 5 prototypes for offshore testing.
 Implemented a variety of new products in the medical, life science and research segment. Cooperated closely with valued customers as The Surgical Company, Maastricht Instruments, Esaote, Enraf, Finapress Medical Systems and BioMetrisch Centrum to produce their inventions.
profile_positions.title: Modification Manager

profile_positions.description:
Hired to provide engineering support for the manufacturing of technical rollers for the office equipment industry. Set up, launched and optimized highly automated production lines and machines. As department responsible for technical purchasing (MRO), facility management and machine park maintenance (corrective 24/7 & preventive).
Promoted to lead the (clean-room) production of fusing and pressure rollers for Océ Printing System. Supervised a team of 9 operators; planned labor and material availability, monitored quality data, maintained the equipment, ensured compliance with procedures and arranged training and team-building activities.

 Developed an automated rubber-grinding machine (with the subsidiary in France) that became part of the High Volume cell for Hewlett Packard. 
 Significantly increased OPS quality yield (FPY>98%) which made these high value rollers very profitable. 
 Joined the transfer team to relocate all equipment and machines to subsidiaries in Hungary and Singapore. Over 100 machines were disassembled, revised, transported and installed at location (e.g.: mill, rubber & plastic injection, assembly & grinding, transportation, robots, vision, packing).
profile_positions.title: Project Engineer
